title: Hargate Forest Walking Route

images.title: Simon Carey / Cleared Area, Hargate Forest
images.caption: Cleared Area, Hargate Forest Caused by a fire in the late 1990s the area has been cleared and will be returned to natural heathland

images.title: Simon Carey / Mixed Conifers, Hargate Forest
images.caption: Mixed Conifers, includes fir and larch. The forest was previously a commercial enterprise and conifers are particularly concentrated in the parts north of Sprat's Brook.

images.title: Simon Carey / Track, Hargate Forest
images.caption: Heading south down the main route into the forest lined with Douglas Firs. The forest was purchased from the Nevill estate in 1996 having previously been a commercial timber enterprise and is now owned by the Woodland Trust.

description: These peaceful woods are located on the edge of Tunbridge Wells. There's a series of footpaths taking you around the site which includes a mixture of broadleaf and conifer woodland. The area is good for widlife spotting with lots of woodland birds and the possibility of spotting fallow or roe deer. Tunbridge Wells West train station is a short walk from the woods so you can easily come by public transport.
